text: Leon Bibb (February 7, 1922 - October 23, 2015) was an American folk singer. He grew up in Kentucky, studied voice in New York, and worked on Broadway. His career began when he became a featured soloist of the Louisville Municipal College glee club as a student. He was known for performing at Hootenanny, on The Ed Sullivan Show and performed with Bill Cosby on tours. He lived in Vancouver, British Columbia in Canada since 1969. He died in Vancouver at the age of 93. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2015 deaths Category:African-American singers Category:American folk singers Category:American folk musicians Category:Musicians from Louisville, Kentucky Category:Singers from Louisville, Kentucky
title: Leon Bibb
